headline: ANP Timor-Leste Concludes a High-Impact ADIPEC 2025, Strengthening Global Partnerships and Investor Interest Ahead of Major 2026 Licensing Round
summary: London, United Kingdom--(Newsfile Corp. - November 11, 2025) - (IN-VR) - The Autoridade Nacional do Petróleo (ANP) of Timor-Leste has successfully concluded its participation at ADIPEC 2025, reinforcing the country's rising profile as Southeast Asia's newest investment destination following its recent admission to ASEAN.Across four days, the ANP delegation held a series of high-level meetings with global energy companies, financial institutions, and technical partners, positioning Timor-Leste as

headline: Exxon Mobil price target raised to $144 from $141 at Piper Sandler
summary: Piper Sandler raised the firm’s price target on Exxon Mobil (XOM) to $144 from $141 and keeps an Overweight rating on the shares. The firm says that although investor concern regarding the near-term outlook for crude oil is keeping sentiment muted for now, Q3 results continue to highlight the strong relative positioning of the group within energy. While consistent with longer-term trends, a few key takeaways remain clear, namely that free cash flow generation is resilient, headline growth remain

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Exxon Mobil (XOM) Dividend Hike and Shift in Low-Carbon Strategy
summary: Exxon Mobil increased its fourth-quarter dividend by 4% to US$1.03 per share, payable on December 10, 2025, to shareholders of record as of November 14, 2025, and continued to reduce its share count through buybacks, having repurchased over 626.91 million shares totaling US$66.55 billion since December 2021. The company is also updating its approach to low-carbon investments due to challenging market and policy conditions, highlighting evolving priorities within its capital allocation...
